intro: Anelasma guianense, commonly known as the Guianese anelasma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Anelasma guianense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
